titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Glen S. Taylor papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Sarah Patton

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-11-04T14:54-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Declassified materials returned and collection arranged/described by Sarah Patton.

did.unittitle: Glen S. Taylor papers
did.abstract: The Glen S. Taylor papers consist of notes, memoranda, correspondence, reports, press releases, and printed matter relating to various aspects of North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) activities.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Glen S. Taylor papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1985.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Director, Office of Statistics, North Atlantic Treaty Organization, 1951-1953.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The majority of the materials in the Glen S. Taylor papers relate to his tenure as the Director of Statistics for the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) from 1951 to 1953. These include notes, meeting summaries, memoranda, correspondence, reports, press releases, and printed matter on administrative topics such as NATO's staff and organization, as well as the broader themes of NATO's role and objectives. Also included in the collection are photographs and an embassy pass from London, 1942.
The original chronological arrangement of the papers has been maintained, though the groupings of materials were created by the archivist.

did.unittitle: Personal File,
Photographs,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Black and white photographs of London depicting buildings and the destruction caused by German bombing of the city.

did.unittitle: Embassy pass and driver's license
Calendars,
Notes,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Handwritten notes, some of which may relate to Taylor's work with NATO, though most seem to address travel arrangements and reservations.

did.unittitle: NATO File,
Chronological file,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, press releases, and handwritten notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes press releases and charts relating to defense expenditures of NATO countries.

did.unittitle: Press cuttings,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: With the exception of one clipping from the Wall Street Journal (1983), the clippings are from European publications (1951-1953).

did.unittitle: Printed matter,

arrangement.head: Arrangement Statement
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically by date of publication.

did.unittitle: Atlantic Alliance: NATO's Role in the Free World, a report by a Study Group of the Royal Institute of International Affairs,
The NATO Handbook: Why the Treaty Was Signed, What the Treaty Says, How NATO Works, NATO Information Service,
The North Atlantic Treaty Organization: A Brief Account of the Development of NATO and an Analysis of Its Present Structure, NATO Information Service,
The NATO Handbook: Why the Treaty Was Signed, What the Treaty Says, How the Organization Developed (two copies), NATO Information Service,
"April 1952 to April 1957," NATO Letter, Vol. 5, special supplement to No. 6,
"A Report on the North Atlantic Treaty Organization," Kyra Taylor,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: An assignment for a U.S. History class written by Glen Taylor's daughter.

did.unittitle: The NATO Handbook, sixth ed., NATO Information Service,
Why NATO?, Paul-Henri Spaak, Secretary-General of NATO,
"Ten Years of Atlantic Co-operation, 1949-1959," NATO Letter, special issue,
"Essential Values of Western Civilization," Lester B. Pearson,
Vigilance: The Price of Liberty, NATO Information Service,
"The Western European Union and NATO Problems,"
Declassified U.S. Government Records,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government, released in full or in part. Includes some interfiled, unclassified government records. Arranged chronologically by date of release, thereunder chronologically by date of creation.

did.unittitle: 2016 February release of records,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memoranda, reports, notes, and correspondence relating to Taylor's work with NATO, originally from the chronological file. Includes report on "Production and Supply Planning," as well as summaries of meetings with various delegations.
